Package synchronization

Class BidirectionalSync

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
synchronization.BidirectionalSync
All Implemented Interfaces:
DirectorySynchronizer, RequestHandler, Serializable, Runnable, Remote
public class BidirectionalSync extends UnicastRemoteObject implements DirectorySynchronizer, RequestHandler, Runnable
BidirectionalSync class provides the functionality to synchronize two directories bidirectionally using RMI (Remote Method Invocation) and a separate synchronization thread. This class implements DirectorySynchronizer, RequestHandler, and Runnable interfaces.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • BidirectionalSync

      public BidirectionalSync(long syncInterval, boolean updateSource) throws RemoteException
      Constructor for BidirectionalSync class.
      Parameters:
      syncInterval - The interval between synchronization checks in milliseconds.
      updateSource - A boolean flag indicating if the source directory should be updated.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote exception occurs during the RMI process.

      Throws:

      public void startSynchronization()
      Starts the synchronization process by starting the RMI server and the synchronization thread.

    • waitForRemote

      public void waitForRemote(String remoteIp) throws RemoteException, MalformedURLException, NotBoundException
      Waits for the remote machine to be ready for synchronization.
      Parameters:
      remoteIp - The IP address of the remote machine.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote exception occurs during the RMI process.
      MalformedURLException - If a malformed URL is encountered during the RMI process.
      NotBoundException - If a NotBoundException occurs during the RMI process.

    • listSourceDirectory

      public List<String[]> listSourceDirectory() throws IOException
      Returns a list of string arrays representing the files in the source directory. Each array contains the relative path, file content, and the last modified timestamp.
      Specified by:
      listSourceDirectory in interface DirectorySynchronizer
      Returns:
      A list of string arrays representing the files in the source directory.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during file reading.
